tldr: This article describes a case study of a young man named Nathaniel Hulme who developed horn-like excrescences on his fingers and toes due to a severe itch or leprosy. The growths hardened into horns, grew up to 2 inches long, and fell off after several months before regrowing. The author, Dr. Rich. Wroe, shares this medical curiosity with the Royal Society and sends them samples of the horns for further study.
